results.title: All manner of trains
results.brief_description: The capacity, scope, problems and future of Australia’s six State and one Commonwealth railway systems. We accompany a railway worker from Cairns to Perth, by rail, and then visit workshops to see carriages and locomotives being made, and modern methods of mechanised track laying. Specially designed rolling stock is used for stock transport, bulk wheat and sugar moving, transporting cars and semi-trailers, and for moving timber. No other credits available.

results.title: All lit up
results.creator_credit: Gas Council, John Halas and Joy Batchelor
results.brief_description: An exhilarating presentation of the story of the use of fire for warmth and comfort since the days of the Romans. Shows something of the inherent problems that have persisted until today; with the use of an ingenious yet simple invention, the major difficulties have been solved.

results.title: All is well on the border front
results.creator_credit: Future Television, Lebanon Theater and Akram Zaatari
results.brief_description: A tribute to Godard’s seminal “Ici et Ailleurs” (Here and Elsewhere), video artist Akram Zaatari’s documentary, like its predecessor, critically explores issues of representation within the occupied zone of South Lebanon. Interviews with Lebanese prisoners in Israel illustrate aspects of life under occupation with convincing poignancy. In Arabic with English subtitles.

results.title: All Is full of love
results.brief_description: Chris Cunningham’s elegant film clip for Bjork’s All is full of love depicts the construction and subsequent desire between two intertwined robots. Designed by Cunningham himself, the two machines, whose faces bear more than a passing resemblance to Bjork sensually move in and around each other as a milky white fluid flows over their sexualised bodies.

results.title: All in together
results.creator_credit: Canaus Films, Film Victoria, Mike Boland and Tarni James
results.brief_description: A warm and inspiring documentary which explores the attitudes and relationships between disabled and abled children through the liberating experience of a week long campout. Both mentally and physically disabled children discover a sense of self and achievement. Parents of disabled children also present their views.

results.title: All in the same boat
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Robin Hughes and Debby Kingsland
results.brief_description: One of three films as part of the National Drug Education Program, this is a documentary on drug dependence in the daily lives of ordinary people. The central character of this film is a suburban housewife, Barbara, in her early twenties. She finds the dreary unchanging routine of her daily life very difficult to accept and the drug Valium has become part of Barbara’s daily life. Photography by Dean Semler. (See also “Thirst” T/C 012683 and “Hassles” T/C 012851)

results.title: All in a lifetime
results.creator_credit: Esso Petrol, John Shearman, Derek Armstrong and Joe Mendoza
results.brief_description: The film marks the 75th. Anniversary of the Esso Petroleum Company and surveys the progress of the oil industry from 1888 to the present day. Within a lifetime, the oil industry has revolutionised our habits and daily life. Historical black and white film shows the first methods of exploration and drilling, then the film pursues oil’s more modern ramifications ranging from the development of the jet engine to the latest oilfields; from laboratory research to motorways; from oil-fired industries to the new world of petrochemicals.

results.title: All in a day
results.brief_description: Filmed at Bradfield Park in New South Wales. The film shows how children can create their own world even in adverse situations. The children’s centre interests young people from pre-school to teenage in painting, drama, dancing and other social activities.

results.title: All I Need Is You

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

results.description: The music video, directed by Richard Maxwell, by Rab Cantor, off his album Not a Trampoline.
description_for_label: The music video, directed by Richard Maxwell, by Rab Cantor, off his album Not a Trampoline.
